articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A day after the interview, a fifth Democratic member of Congress has called on him to end his bid for re-election.
articles.title: TV interview fails to quell Democrats' concerns about Biden's fitness

articles.description: Anna Ardin accused Julian Assange of sexual assault - but is pleased he has been freed from jail.
articles.title: Julian Assange's sexual assault accuser is "happy" he's free

articles.description: France votes in one of its most crucial elections in years, with the far right hoping for victory.
articles.title: French election: As France votes, far right hopes to win but deadlock looms

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Cycling's governing body says the fine is for "unseemly or inappropriate behaviour".
articles.title: Cyclist Julien Bernard fined for kissing wife during Tour de France

articles.description: The school, located in the Nuseirat refugee camp, was sheltering displaced people, Palestinian officials say.
articles.title: Air strike on Gaza school kills at least 15 people

articles.description: The Labour leader says he wants to cut reoffending to mean fewer people are sent to jail.
articles.title: We have too many prisoners, says new PM Keir Starmer

articles.description: Around 1,000 people are suffering diarrhoea and vomiting linked to one city's school meals.
articles.title: South Korea: Kimchi blamed for mass norovirus sickness

articles.title: Iran election: Reformer Massoud Pezeshkian elected new president

articles.description: Russia continues to pummel energy sites across Ukraine, plunging the country into extended blackouts.
articles.title: Ukraine war: Russian air strike leaves 100,000 with no power

articles.description: Con men threaten to extradite their victims to China if they don’t pay “bail”.
articles.title: Scammed by the fake Chinese police
